1.text: Use water-soluble markers to color a coffee filter.

2.text: Pinch the edge of the coffee filter and hold it up.

3.text: Spray the coffee filter with water to make the colors spread.

4.text: Lay the coffee filter out to dry completely.

5.text: Use a marker to draw a circle 1 in (2.5 cm) from the center of the filter.

6.text: Fold the coffee filter into a cone.

7.text: Stick the tip of the cone into a glass of water and remove it immediately.

8.text: Watch the colors separate and spread across the coffee filter.

9.text: Lay out the coffee filter until it dries completely.

10.text: Scrunch the middle of the dry coffee filter to create 2 wings.

11.text: Wrap a pipe cleaner around the filter to create a body.

12.text: Bend the ends of the pipe cleaner to look like antennae.

13.text: Spread out the wings to make them look like a butterfly.
